meanings.definition: Provide more service than necessary or requested.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic tends to overservice my car, always recommending unnecessary repairs.
meanings.sent2: I hope the restaurant doesn't overservice us with too many appetizers before our main course.
meanings.sent3: The barber accidentally overserviced my haircut, leaving me with a much shorter style than I wanted.
meanings.sent4: She overserviced her presentation with too many slides, overwhelming the audience with information.
meanings.sent5: The hotel staff's eagerness to overservice their guests led to unnecessary expenses for the management.

meanings.sent1: The overservicing of the car resulted in a hefty bill for repairs.
meanings.sent2: The overservicing of the lawn equipment led to unnecessary wear and tear.
meanings.sent3: The overservicing of the air conditioning unit caused it to break down sooner than expected.
meanings.sent4: The overservicing of the computer system caused it to slow down due to unnecessary programs.
meanings.sent5: The overservicing of the customers with constant follow-up calls annoyed them rather than helped.
